column4: Hi all, i am installing Ubuntu on a Compaq  Proliant ML530, and it won't read data from the CD. I get an error upon scanning the CD. What is this caused by?
You migh have had a corrupted download, check your ISO's md5sum
i went through 5 CD's from 5 dfifferent mirrors.
i also get an ACPI=Force upon load
Did you checksum any of them?
How much RAM does the laptop have?
sry, how much RAM does the server have?
it is a Compaq Proliant ML530 with dual 866Mhz xeons and 1280Mb ram (not allocated to system devices)
and no, it is not "128Mb" is is 2Gb but some is allocated
Try booting with the noacpi option
There's a boot option button on the main screen (I think it's F6, not sure), add noacpi at the end
